posts.content:
Hi all ECBers and happy holidays to all

I have been exploring primary bard builds. 

This post examines in addition using the Arcane Archer class as a melee fighter (an idea I believe hasn't been completely explored yet) by also adding RDD, an idea which has been explored but largely I think to create primarily devastating critical bow wielders (correct me if I'm wrong) without particularly looking at improving its melee prowess.

It is an interesting concept, with the tremendous AB bonuses provided by AA along with it providing martial weapon proficiency, medium armor proficiency, shield proficiency and a full BAB class, a dually proficient melee fighter and ranged fighter.

As one is aware ranged weapons have significant weaknesses in comparison to melee weapons, including requiring ammunition, triggering attacks of opportunity, lack of active combat feats, damage problems and in vanilla NWN the inability to buff weapons with spells and abilities such as GMW/Darkfire/Flame Weapon/Keen Weapon which melee weapons are able to take advantage of, making a dual build attractive in some ways

1. Vanilla build

This build draft has 
- a base strength of 40, 
- base melee AB of 46, 
- base ranged AB of 37, 
- 372hp
- +12 to AC from tumble 40 and RDD AC bonuses
- 253 skill points, allowing one to max discipline, listen, spellcraft and invest in tumble/UMD/search/perform in such a way each skill is useful in the build, and also provide +9 to saves against spells
- all ending base saves above 20
- blind fight, point blank shot, knockdown, curse song for combat feats
- bard spells up to level 6 (level 6 spells enabled with items adding to charisma or level 6 spell slots)

2. Dev crit greatsword
This draft I have written has devastating critical greatsword at the cost of knockdown and four great strengths, it has a Base AB of 44 and Str of 36, blind fight also comes very late (it could be swapped for knockdown).

3. Dual dev crit scimitar and longbow
It is possible to combine dual dev crit into the build and it is ridiculously ambitious. 

This draft version loses blind fight, knockdown and all the great strengths in the build, it ends up with a Base Str of 34, Base melee AB of 40, Base Ranged AB of 40 but devastating critical scimitar and devastating critical longbow.  I also made adjustments to the starting Dex score and included into the build the toughness feat to make up some HP from the reduced Cons score.

I believe this version of the build effectively functions through the bard song/curse song abilities, which can boost AB by 2 and reduce enemies AC by up to 5, granting the build an 'effective' AB of 47 which one is supposed further to add  buffs such as Bull's Strength, Cat's Grace, Greater Magic Weapon, Warcry, UMD abilities etc... to boost it even higher

Because the strength was nerfed by 6 units and I was also wary of not having blind fight in the build, I have opted to go with scimitar and shield in this draft

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
The idea of a strength based AA is not entirely new, but in my opinion it has not been fully explored.
 What makes it possible is the power of the Enchant arrow feat of the AA class that gives a bonus to ranged AB and damage every second level. That feat alone takes care of the archery prowess, whereas strength gives a good melee presence with consistent damage and a possible Dev crit both on melee and ranged weapons. The strength based bonus to ranged damage depends on sufficiently good mighty bows.
AA has its limitations as a melee class though. The hit die is low and you get no melee related feats other than the proficiencies. But it works well for characters with a dual focus on both melee and bows.
